intro: Casparia confusa, commonly known as the confused casparia, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its palm-like appearance, with a central stem and large, lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, attracting various pollinators. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Casparia confusa is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks in its native range.
